page.title: 13CRAFTS OF H.GREEN&HAZLEMERE
page.content: Mrs.Clark is a potter who lives in Heather Walk.Her clay is bought in Rickmansworth.Mrs.Clark sells the articles that she makes.She is exhibiting in Beaconsfield Gallery.The stones that line the kiln are of the same material used on the heat-resistant part of the space shuttle.Mr.Parsons is an art teacher at Holmer Green secondary school.He went to the West of England college of art for 5 years.He paints about 50 paintings per year.He has paintings all around the world.Mrs.Reading began lace-making at evening classes.The way lace is made is by weaving cottons around pins.The placement of pins make the pattern of the lace.Lace is made on a pillow and the cottons are attatched to bobbins.
